Philip Williams

Philip Williams is a professional Bodybuilder, Aircraft Mechanic, Inspirational Speaker, Veteran, Friend, and Father. He also suffers from a debilitating disease, Myasthenia Gravis... But he never let something like that hold him back.

Myasthenia WHAT?!!!?

While prepping for a bodybuilding show in February of 2012, Philip Williams started having spells of dizziness while working out. He was 6 weeks from a show and believed these spells were due to low body fat and carbohydrate cycling. He kept pushing through as his symptoms worsened, and eventually expanded to include double vision and muscle weakness.

Myasthenia Gravis

What it is

Myasthenia gravis (MG) is a neuromuscular disorder that causes weakness in the skeletal muscles, which are the muscles your body uses for movement. It occurs when communication between nerve cells and muscles becomes impaired. This impairment prevents crucial muscle contractions from occurring, resulting in muscle weakness.

What it does

The main symptom of MG is weakness in the voluntary skeletal muscles, which are muscles under your control. The failure of muscles to contract normally occurs because they canâ€™t respond to nerve impulses. Without proper transmission of the impulse, the communication between nerve and muscle is blocked and weakness results.

How it Struck

After several doctors visits, and a misdiagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis, his symptoms still became more dabilitating. Finally, in the Fall of 2012, he was diagnosed with Myasthenia Gravis. After 9 months of treatment his symptoms began to subside and his doctor told him that he could resume working out but his bodybuilding career is over. Mission Accepted

Stop Bullying

Phil has taken his life to the next level, in every way, including Inspiration, where he has participated in the #stopbullyingnow campaign with friend and fellow bodybuilder Willie Raines a.k.a "Freight Train." #stopbullyingnow is a campaign that conducts school assemblies by using feats of strength to inspire elementary, middle and high school students to set challenging goals and act more courageously by minimizing the impact of negative social influences on their goals.

Bodybuilding

Once given the green light to workout, Phil began prepping for his next show. And in spite of being told he would never compete again, Phil won multiple shows from 2014-2018, and finally earned his pro card and became an International Federation of Body Building and Fitness (IFBB) professional bodybuilder.
